summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorneys regarding upcoming court appearances in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses an arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2021, and a bail appeal oral argument scheduled for April 26, 2021.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of email correspondence regarding court scheduling.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of email correspondence regarding court scheduling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, subject of the court appearances discussed.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge who scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021.

connections.description: Brad Edwards is listed as a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell in the correspondence.
Brittany Henderson is listed as a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell in the correspondence.
Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating on court scheduling.

events.title: Arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: In-person arraignment scheduled by Judge Nathan at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: Remote oral argument scheduled by the Second Circuit at 10 a.m. regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal, to be livestreamed.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell had an in-person arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2021, in the Southern District of New York.
A bail appeal oral argument was scheduled for April 26, 2021, in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in April 2021.
The document shows coordination between the prosecution and defense attorneys (Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson) regarding court appearances.
